Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports

Class AbstractDataInboundPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPort
            • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractInboundPort
              • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractDataInboundPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentInterface, DataOfferedCI.PullCI, DataOfferedCI.PushCI, OfferedCI, RequiredCI, DataInboundPortI, InboundPortI, PortI, Serializable, Remote
    public abstract class AbstractDataInboundPort
extends AbstractInboundPort
implements DataInboundPortI
    The class AbstractDataInboundPort partially implements an inbound port for data exchanging components.

    Description

    Data exchanging components focus their interaction on the exchange of pieces of data rather than calling each others services. Hence, the required and offered interfaces merely implements a simple protocol in terms of methods used to pass data from the provider to the clients. But data exchanges can be done in two modes: pull (the primary one) and push. For inbound port, representing interfaces through which a provider is called, the port implements the offered pull interface, while the connector implements the offered push interface through which data can be pushed from the provider towards the client.

    A concrete inbound connector must therefore implement the method get which will ask the owner component for a piece of data and provide as result.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 2011-11-07

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • AbstractDataInboundPort

        public AbstractDataInboundPort​(String uri,
                               Class<? extends DataOfferedCI.PullCI> implementedPullInterface,
                               Class<? extends DataOfferedCI.PushCI> implementedPushInterface,
                               ComponentI owner,
                               String pluginURI,
                               String executorServiceURI)
                        throws Exception
        create and initialise data inbound ports, with a given URI.

        Contract

         pre    uri != null and owner != null
 pre    implementedPullInterface != null
 pre    implementedPushInterface != null
 pre    pluginURI == null || owner.isInstalled(pluginURI)
 pre    executorServiceURI == null || owner.validExecutorServiceURI(executorServiceURI)
 post   !isDestroyed()
 post   getPortURI().equals(uri)
 post   getOwner().equals(owner)
 post   !connected()
 post !isRemotelyConnected()
 post   owner.isPortExisting(uri)
 post   getImplementedInterface().equals(implementedPullInterface)
 post   getImplementedPushInterface().equals(implementedPushInterface)
        Parameters:
        uri - unique identifier of the port.
        implementedPullInterface - pull interface implemented by this port.
        implementedPushInterface - push interface implemented by this port.
        owner - component that owns this port.
        pluginURI - URI of the plug-in to be called in the owner or null if none.
        executorServiceURI - URI of the executor service to be used to execute the service on the component or null if none.
        Throws:
        Exception - to do.
